data.text:
Premier Ioseb Besarionis dze (Joseph Vissarionovich) Stalin formerly Jughashvili

Born 18 Dec 1878 in Gori, Tiflis Governorate, Russian Empire

Ancestors

[sibling(s) unknown]

Husband of Nadezhda Sergeevna Alliluyeva — married [date unknown] [location unknown]

Husband of Ekaterina Svanidze — married 1906 (to 1907) [location unknown]

Descendants

Died 5 Mar 1953 at age 74 in Kuntsevo Dacha near Moscow, Russian SFSR, Soviet Union

Profile last modified 20 Aug 2024 | Created 2 Dec 2012

This page has been accessed 8,050 times.

Joseph Vissarionovich (Jughashvili) Stalin has Russian Roots.

Join: Russian Roots Project

Discuss: russian_roots

Biography

Joseph Stalin was a Soviet revolutionary and politician who was the leader of the Soviet Union from 1924 until his death in 1953. He held power as General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union (1922–1952) and Chairman of the Council of Ministers of the Soviet Union (1941–1953). Initially governing the country as part of a collective leadership, he consolidated power to become a dictator by the 1930s. Ideologically adhering to the Leninist interpretation of Marxism, he formalized these ideas as Marxism–Leninism, while his own policies are called Stalinism.

He was born Joseph Vissarionovich Stalin, which in Russian is Иосиф Виссарионович Сталин and in Georgian is იოსებ ბესარიონის ძე სტალინი.

Sources

Wikidata: Item Q855, en:Wikipedia

Josef Stalin Original name: Iosif Dzhugashvili on Find A Grave: Memorial #970 Retrieved 17:28, 21 April 2017 (EDT).
